trans-unit.source: Connect to SQL Database by using Node.js with Tedious on Mac OS X
trans-unit.target: Connect to SQL Database by using Node.js with Tedious on Mac OS X

trans-unit.source: Presents a Node.js code sample you can use to connect to Azure SQL Database. The sample uses the Tedious driver to connect.
trans-unit.target: Presents a Node.js code sample you can use to connect to Azure SQL Database. The sample uses the Tedious driver to connect.

trans-unit.source: This topic presents a Node.js code sample that runs on Mac OS X. The sample connects to Azure SQL Database by using the Tedious driver.
trans-unit.target: This topic presents a Node.js code sample that runs on Mac OS X. The sample connects to Azure SQL Database by using the Tedious driver.

trans-unit.source: Install node, unless it is already installed on your machine.
trans-unit.target: Install node, unless it is already installed on your machine.

trans-unit.source: To install node.js on OSX 10.10 Yosemite you can download a pre-compiled binary package which makes a nice and easy installation.
trans-unit.target: To install node.js on OSX 10.10 Yosemite you can download a pre-compiled binary package which makes a nice and easy installation.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Head over to nodejs.org</linkText><title></title> and click the install button to download the latest package.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Head over to nodejs.org</linkText><title></title> and click the install button to download the latest package.

trans-unit.source: Install the package from the .dmg by following along the install wizard which will install both node and npm, npm is Node Package Manager which facilitates installs of additional packages for node.js.
trans-unit.target: Install the package from the .dmg by following along the install wizard which will install both node and npm, npm is Node Package Manager which facilitates installs of additional packages for node.js.

trans-unit.source: After your machine is configured with node and npm, navigate to a directory where you plan to create your Node.js project, and enter the following commands.
trans-unit.target: After your machine is configured with node and npm, navigate to a directory where you plan to create your Node.js project, and enter the following commands.

trans-unit.source: npm init creates a node project.
trans-unit.target: npm init creates a node project.

trans-unit.source: To retain the defaults during your project creation, press enter until the project is created.
trans-unit.target: To retain the defaults during your project creation, press enter until the project is created.

trans-unit.source: Now you see a package.json file in your project directory.
trans-unit.target: Now you see a package.json file in your project directory.

trans-unit.source: The code sample in this topic expects an AdventureWorks test database.
trans-unit.target: The code sample in this topic expects an AdventureWorks test database.

trans-unit.source: If you do not already have one, see <linkText>Get started with SQL Database</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: If you do not already have one, see <linkText>Get started with SQL Database</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: It is important that you follow the guide to create an AdventureWorks database template.
trans-unit.target: It is important that you follow the guide to create an AdventureWorks database template.

trans-unit.source: The examples shown below work only with the AdventureWorks schema.
trans-unit.target: The examples shown below work only with the AdventureWorks schema.

trans-unit.source: The <linkText>new Connection</linkText><title></title> function is used to connect to SQL Database.
trans-unit.target: The <linkText>new Connection</linkText><title></title> function is used to connect to SQL Database.

trans-unit.source: All SQL statements are executed using the <linkText>new Request()</linkText><title></title> function.
trans-unit.target: All SQL statements are executed using the <linkText>new Request()</linkText><title></title> function.

trans-unit.source: If the statement returns rows, such as a select statement, you can retreive them using the <linkText>request.on()</linkText><title></title> function.
trans-unit.target: If the statement returns rows, such as a select statement, you can retreive them using the <linkText>request.on()</linkText><title></title> function.

trans-unit.source: If there are no rows, <linkText>request.on()</linkText><title></title> function returns empty lists.
trans-unit.target: If there are no rows, <linkText>request.on()</linkText><title></title> function returns empty lists.

trans-unit.source: In SQL Database the <linkText>IDENTITY</linkText><title></title> property and the <linkText>SEQUENCE</linkText><title></title> object can be used to auto-generate <linkText>primary key</linkText><title></title> values.
trans-unit.target: In SQL Database the <linkText>IDENTITY</linkText><title></title> property and the <linkText>SEQUENCE</linkText><title></title> object can be used to auto-generate <linkText>primary key</linkText><title></title> values.

trans-unit.source: In this example you will see how to execute an insert-statement, safely pass parameters which protects from SQL injection, and retrieve the auto-generated primary key value.
trans-unit.target: In this example you will see how to execute an insert-statement, safely pass parameters which protects from SQL injection, and retrieve the auto-generated primary key value.

trans-unit.source: The code sample in this section applies parameters to an SQL INSERT statement.
trans-unit.target: The code sample in this section applies parameters to an SQL INSERT statement.

trans-unit.source: The primary key value that is generated is retrieved by the program.
trans-unit.target: The primary key value that is generated is retrieved by the program.
